page.title: 06Religion Droxford Church
page.content: St.Mary and All Saints,Diocese Portsmouth.3 Norman arches. worth 20 shillings in{Domesday Book},it is now insured for Â£250000.The rector has been here 11yrs.and retires this year. He is also the vicar of Meonstoke, Corhampton & Exton.In the 4 parishes there are about 24 Christenings,11 weddings,8 cremations and 6 burials each year.There is no more room in {Droxford}Churchyard for burials.There is only 1 main Communion service per month at{Droxford},2 Evensong and 1 Matins.The ringers practice Thursdays There are 5 bells weighing altogether 6 tons.Church funds come mainly through a stewardship campaign every 7 years.The box pews were refixed when a new floor replaced wet and dry rot timbers.Frost,damp and beetle persist. By font is a spectacular new memorial window,"The Mystery of the Creation"
